Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for containerized workloads, scalability, and availability. Identify the applications and services that will be deployed on AKS.
Design the AKS cluster architecture, including node pools, regions, and integration with existing Azure resources.
Ensure all required authorizations and approvals are obtained for deploying AKS, including budget approvals and security compliance checks.
Create and configure the AKS cluster in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify node pool sizes, Kubernetes version, and networking options.
Set up networking for the AKS cluster, including virtual networks, subnets, and DNS integration. Configure network policies for traffic control.
Enable security features such as Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and pod security policies.
Deploy containerized applications to the AKS cluster using Kubernetes manifests or Helm charts. Ensure proper resource allocation and scaling configurations.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the AKS cluster using Azure Monitor and Container Insights. Configure alerts for node health, pod performance, and resource utilization.
Set up backup solutions for persistent volumes and disaster recovery plans for the AKS cluster.
Perform thorough testing of the AKS cluster and deployed applications, including failover scenarios, scaling tests, and performance benchmarks.
Document the AKS cluster architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting AKS clusters and containerized applications.
Verify that the AKS setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to ensure security and operational standards.
